description: A winner of the Nobel in economic science discusses how we make choices in business and personal lives and when we can and cannot trust our intuitions.
title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
author: Daniel Kahneman

description: A psychologist says passion and perseverance are the keys to success.
title: GRIT
author: Angela Duckworth

description: Cells, elevators, smartphones, nuclear reactors and more are demystified with simply annotated blueprints. From the author of "What If?"
title: THING EXPLAINER
author: Randall Munroe

description: The creator of the New York Times dialect quiz provides a guide to how words are pronounced in different parts of the country.
title: SPEAKING AMERICAN
author: Josh Katz

description: The experience of the young Pakistani advocate for womenâ€™s education who was shot by the Taliban and later won the Nobel Peace Prize. Originally published in 2013.
title: I AM MALALA
author: Malala Yousafzai with Christina Lamb

description: A memoir that is a master class on the writer's craft.
title: ON WRITING
author: Stephen King

description: How decisions that impact our lives are made by algorithms instead of people.
title: WEAPONS OF MATH DESTRUCTION
author: Cathy O'Neil

description: A wide-ranging anthology selected by high school students.
title: BEST AMERICAN NONREQUIRED READING 2016
author: edited  Rachel Kushner

description: A mathematician shows how his discipline helps us think about problems of politics, medicine and commerce.
title: HOW NOT TO BE WRONG
author: Jordan Ellenberg

description: From the blog of the same name, 64 intriguing words from a dozen languages.
title: OTHER-WORDLY
